Business Development Manager Job at FoodCourt




        
    

        
        FoodCourt is a revolutionary food-tech company on a mission to make good food accessible, on demand to everyone. Our values include innovation, customer satisfaction and teamwork.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Manager

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We’re hiring a Business Development Manager to find, sign & launch the most sought-after brands in Nigeria, secure category leaders, and negotiate killer deals (exclusivity, premium margins, co-marketing).


Responsibilities
What You’ll Do:
     

            
    




	Sign 10–15 high-value partners/month
	Achieve 80% coverage of top brands per category
	Fill category gaps & keep SKUs in stock
	Drive 30% MoM GMV growth from your portfolio We’re looking for:
	A deal-closer with 5+ years in BD/partnerships (e-comm, FMCG, retail)
	A high networker, strategist & data-driven
	A rockstar who is hungry to win & ready to shape the future of commerce in Africa


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 6-8 years of work experience.


You’ll love it here if you crave:


	Autonomy, trust, and real impact from Day 1
	High-energy, fast-moving teams
	Ownership of your playbook, tools, and wins.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: Careers@getfoodcourt.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

	We are seeking an experienced Structural Design Engineer to join our team.

	This role requires a strong technical background in structural engineering principles, proficiency in design software, and the ability to collaborate effectively with multidisciplinary teams.

	Perform structural analysis and design calculations for a variety of building and infrastructure projects

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Managing Director",
  "description": "Prosperity Microfinance Bank Nigeria Limited (PMBank) is a Microfinance Bank incorporated in Nigeria with the Corporate Affairs Commission of Nigeria in March 2005 under the provisions of the Companies and Allied Matters Act CAP C20 LFN 2004 with registration number RC 620230 and commenced operations on 10th October 2005. It is licensed to carry on the business of microfinance banking by the Central Bank of Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Managing Director

Job Location:&nbsp;Benin, Edo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Purpose


	The Managing Director (MD) is responsible for providing overall leadership, strategic direction, and operational oversight of the Microfinance Bank.
	The MD ensures the bank&rsquo;s profitability, regulatory compliance, financial sustainability, and alignment with its vision of promoting financial inclusion.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide strategic leadership and direction for the bank in line with policies approved by the Board of Directors.
	Formulate, implement, and monitor business strategies that drive profitability, sustainability, and growth.
	Ensure compliance with the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN), NDIC, and all other regulatory requirements.
	Oversee day-to-day operations, ensuring efficiency, customer satisfaction, and adherence to best practices.
	Lead risk management practices, including credit portfolio quality, liquidity, and operational risk control.
	Drive innovation and digital transformation to improve financial services delivery and customer reach.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders, including customers, regulators, shareholders, and the community.
	Prepare and present periodic operational and financial reports to the Board of Directors.

Managing Director Job at Prosperity Microfinance Bank Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Prosperity Microfinance Bank Nigeria Limited (PMBank) is a Microfinance Bank incorporated in Nigeria with the Corporate Affairs Commission of Nigeria in March 2005 under the provisions of the Companies and Allied Matters Act CAP C20 LFN 2004 with registration number RC 620230 and commenced operations on 10th October 2005. It is licensed to carry on the business of microfinance banking by the Central Bank of Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Managing Director

Job Location: Benin, Edo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Purpose
     

            
    




	The Managing Director (MD) is responsible for providing overall leadership, strategic direction, and operational oversight of the Microfinance Bank.
	The MD ensures the bank’s profitability, regulatory compliance, financial sustainability, and alignment with its vision of promoting financial inclusion.


Key Responsibilities


	Provide strategic leadership and direction for the bank in line with policies approved by the Board of Directors.
	Formulate, implement, and monitor business strategies that drive profitability, sustainability, and growth.
	Ensure compliance with the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN), NDIC, and all other regulatory requirements.
	Oversee day-to-day operations, ensuring efficiency, customer satisfaction, and adherence to best practices.
	Lead risk management practices, including credit portfolio quality, liquidity, and operational risk control.
	Drive innovation and digital transformation to improve financial services delivery and customer reach.
	Build and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders, including customers, regulators, shareholders, and the community.
	Prepare and present periodic operational and financial reports to the Board of Directors.
	Champion corporate governance, transparency, accountability, and ethical business practices.
	Lead, mentor, and motivate management and staff to achieve organizational objectives.
	Identify and develop new products, services, and markets that align with the bank’s mission of financial inclusion.


Qualifications & Experience


	Minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in Banking & Finance, Accounting, Economics, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 10 years of banking experience, at least 5 years in senior management positions within microfinance, commercial, or development banking.
	A Master’s degree (MBA, MSc) and/or professional certifications (ACIB, ICAN, ACCA, CFA, CIBN) will be an added advantage.
	Strong understanding of CBN regulations, microfinance operations, credit administration, and financial management.
	Proven track record of business growth, leadership, and strategic execution.


Salary
N370,000 - N400,000 monthly.

Method of Application
